page.title: 02COUNCIL HOUSING IN WHITELEAS
page.content: Most of the houses in this area are 25 to 30 years old.They were almost all built for the local council,but many tenants have now bought them.They are mainly short terraces of family-sized houses with flats for single people on the corners.There are some semi- detached houses chiefly on the main roads. A few houses were built for owner- occupiers.These are mainly detached and semi-detached houses.There are a lot of bungalows in the area for old people to live in. Some terraced housing on the estate is owned by the National Coal Board. Miners'families live in these.Unlike the other houses in the area,these houses only have a front garden.
